data.title: Herald Bulletin
data.meta_description: Gloria Stuart passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the Herald Bulletin on 2011-08-31.
data.text:
Gloria R. Stuart, 67, of Greens Fork, passed away unexpectedly, Monday, Aug. 29, 2011, while traveling through Fort Worth, Texas. She was born on Nov. 17, 1943, in Anderson, to Raymond W. and Cleota Morr Crick, and had lived most of her life in the Greens Fork area. She was a farmer's wife and owner of Cruises and Travel by Gloria. She was a member of Cruise Lines International Academy, First United Methodist Church and Nettle Creek Young Farmers. She was a past 4-H leader, past Business & Professional Women's president and past Chamber of Commerce president. She was a former member of Job's Daughters and Eastern Star of Anderson. She also taught piano for 24 years. Gloria loved spending time with all her grandchildren and she and Kenny enjoyed wintering in Mission, Texas Survivors are her husband of 45 years, Kenneth W. Stuart; children, Jon (Sherry) Stuart, Tamara (Jeff) Burris and Dustin (Erin) Stuart; and four grandchildren, Kyndall, Paige, Alek and Brooke. She was preceded in death by her parents; and a brother, Robert W. Crick. Funeral services will be at 3 p.m. Saturday at Waskom Capitol Hill Chapel in Cambridge City with Pastor Rodney Frieden officiating. Burial will follow in Salem Cemetery near Greens Fork. Friends may call at the funeral home from noon until the start of service. Memorial contributions may be made to First United Methodist Church in Hagerstown. Post online condolences at www.waskoms.com or www.theheraldbulletin.com.

Published on August 31, 2011

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentineâ€™s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
